business.headline: Sensex closes 346 points lower, Nifty below 25,400; Airtel down 3%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 345.80 points to end at 83,190.28, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 120.85 points to close at 25,355.25.

Dubai dreams under scanner as ED questions homebuyers: ReportMany of the individuals who bought property in Dubai are now under scrutiny as they failed to provide proper bank transaction records showing how the payments were made.

8th Pay Commission may hike salaries by 30–34%: ReportThe 8th Pay Commission could benefit around 11 million people, including about 4.4 million central government employees and nearly 6.8 million pensioners. Once approved, the changes will raise their basic pay, allowances, and retirement benefits.

Will ITR filing deadline be extended again? Here's why it mightIn May, the CBDT announced extending the ITR filing deadline, citing big changes in the forms and system readiness. It said that the updated ITRs will make compliance simpler and reporting more transparent for taxpayers.

Zepto, Blinkit, Instamart face a new rival in Delhi's 10-min delivery warThe move brings the e-commerce giant into direct competition with local players such as Blinkit (owned by Eternal), Swiggy Instamart and Zepto, who already dominate the quick delivery space.

Smartworks Coworking Spaces IPO open for bidding: Should you subscribe?The bidding window for the IPO will remain open until Monday, July 14. Investors can place bids within the price band of Rs 387 to Rs 407 per share.

When nursery fees need an EMI: CoinSwitch co-founder flags new middle-class crisisOnce believed to be the key to a better life, schooling today has ironically become the heaviest expense for India's middle-class families, who are struggling to keep up, says Ashish Singhal, co-founder of CoinSwitch.

Nvidia now worth nearly as much as India's economy. Details hereAccording to the International Monetary Fund (IMF), India's gross domestic product is currently estimated at $4.2 trillion and is expected to touch $4.27 trillion by the end of 2025.

3 key reasons behind Bitcoin's record high todayAt the time of writing, Bitcoin is trading at $111,019.74, rising by 2.27% over the past day. The last record was set on May 22 when it briefly touched $111,970. Since then, Bitcoin has had a bumpy ride, but it seems to be back with a bang.

TCS to announce Q1 results today: Here's what to expect from the IT giantTCS Q1 results: Apart from growth numbers, the market will also watch for any announcements on interim dividends, updates on client budgets in sectors like banking, retail, and manufacturing, and comments on the pace of new deal wins.
Sensex opens 85 points higher, Nifty above 25,400; Tata Steel up 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 43.60 points to 83,492.48, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 15.90 points to 25,460.20 as of 9:28 am.

Bitcoin rockets to a record high, just shy of $112,000. Here's whyAs Bitcoin's market cap has crossed into the trillions, more institutional investors are entering the space. Large firms that once stayed away are now taking positions in digital assets, helping push prices higher.

entertainment.headline: When Saif Ali Khan told Sharmila Tagore he doesn't want her, recalls Soha Ali KhanActor Soha Ali Khan recently recalled that as a working mother, Sharmila Tagore didn't see Saif Ali Khan for weeks during his childhood. She mentioned how Saif would get upset with mother Sharmila when she came to meet him.

Here's why Sunny Deol has only 15-minute screen time as Lord Hanuman in RamayanaNitesh Tiwari's 'Ramayana: Part 1', featuring Ranbir Kapoor and Yash, will release during Diwali 2026. Sunny Deol as Lord Hanuman will have a limited role in the first part with a bigger part in the 2027 sequel, promising a grand spectacle.

The Paradise: Raghav Juyal joins Nani's film, makers share BTS clip on his birthdayOn Raghav Juyal's birthday, the makers of Nani's 'The Paradise' officially welcomed him to the cast with a BTS video. In the clip, director Srikanth Odela teased Juyal's dark and brutal character.

Priyanka Chopra reacts to hot dog vs vada pav backlash: It's not that seriousPriyanka Chopra sparked an online debate after choosing hot dog over vada pav during a rapid-fire food round at her film premiere. Reacting to the backlash, she said, "It's not that serious," reminding fans not to overthink her food choices.

Family refuses to accept Pakistani actor Humaira Asghar Ali's bodyPakistani actor Humaira Asghar Ali was found dead in her locked Karachi apartment, with reports suggesting she had died nearly three weeks earlier. Her family's refusal to claim the body has sparked widespread shock and prompted authorities to step in for her final rites.

Exclusive: Madhavan explains why some men are seen as toxic despite good intentionsActor Madhavan opened up about how men are perceived as toxic despite good intentions. In an exclusive conversation with India Today, he highlighted the confusion men face adapting to new ways of respecting women in modern society.

Payal Rohatgi-Sangram Singh shut down divorce rumours with anniversary celebrationAmid divorce rumours, Payal Rohatgi and Sangram Singh clarified that they are still together and celebrated their third wedding anniversary recently. Sangram dismissed the speculation, saying they have been together for 14 years and will always be.

Vikrant Massey on playing Sri Sri Ravi Shankar: I can only attempt to be himVikrant Massey opened up about meeting Sri Sri Ravi Shankar ahead of filming the biopic 'White'. The film will showcase the spiritual leader's role in Colombia's civil war resolution and his wider contributions.

Baahubali turns 10: How it went from disaster talks to achieving Tollywood gloryWhen 'Baahubali: The Beginning' released in 2015, the stakes were sky-high and expectations even higher. But what began with disaster talks in the Telugu states soon evolved into a cultural reset, one that would shape the trajectory of Indian cinema for the next decade.
Top films and shows to watch on Netflix this weekendFrom love stories and suspense thrillers to reality shows and family dramas, here's what you can watch on Netflix this weekend.

Firing at Kapil Sharma's newly opened cafe in CanadaUnidentified gunmen opened fire at the building housing comedian Kapil Sharma's cafe, Kap's Cafe, in Surrey, Canada. The cafe was recently launched and pictures have gone viral. The attackers reportedly arrived in a car and fled soon after. No one was injured in the incident.  Unidentified gunmen opened fire at the building housing comedian Kapil Sharma's cafe, Kap's Cafe, in Surrey, Canada. The cafe was recently launched and pictures have gone viral. The attackers reportedly arrived in a car and fled soon after. No one was injured in the incident. 
Khalistani terrorist Harjeet Singh Laddi has taken responsibility for this attack. Ladddi is the most wanted terrorist of India's NIA and is associated with BKI (Babbar Khalsa International).

The Society trailer: Bigg Boss meets Squid Game in Munawar's new show Munawar Faruqui's new show, 'The Society', appears to draw inspiration from 'Bigg Boss', 'Lock Upp' and 'Squid Game'. The reality show is slated to premiere on OTT platform on July 21.

Oho Enthan Baby review: A funny, feel-good drama that falls prey to clichesRelease Date:Thu Jul 10, 2025Oho Enthan Baby movie review: Directed by Krishnakumar Ramkumar, 'Oho Enthan Baby', starring Rudra and Mithila Palkar, is a feel-good romantic drama that loses grip in its second half. With a gripping first half and glorious meta references, it manages to entertain mostly, before falling prey to clichés.

Firing at Kapil Sharma's cafe in Canada, Khalistani terrorist claims responsibilityHarjeet Singh Laddi, one of the most-wanted terrorists listed by National Investigation Agency (NIA), has claimed responsibility for the attack on Kapil Sharma's cafe in Canada.

Dexter Resurrection OTT release: When and where to watch in IndiaPrime Video will debut the mystery series 'Dexter: Resurrection' in India on July 12, featuring stars like Michael C Hall, Peter Dinklage, and Uma Thurman. It coincides with Amazon's Prime Day celebrations.

Shilpa Shetty steers clear of Marathi row, calls herself a Marathi mulgiShilpa Shetty, embracing her Marathi roots, urged people to avoid controversies over the language debate in Maharashtra. She addressed the row while promoting her upcoming Kannada film 'KD'.
Fans say Hugh Grant looks stylish even while napping at Wimbledon 2025Hugh Grant's outing at Wimbledon 2025 stirred mixed reactions on social media. He was captured nodding off during a match.

Actor Prosenjit clarifies after language remark row: Bengali is language of my lifeBengali superstar Prosenjit Chatterjee addressed the controversy over his remarks about the Bengali language during a Hindi film event, clarifying that his comment was misunderstood and not meant to offend.

The top BTS songs of all time, rankedAs BTS members RM, SUGA, Jin, V, Jungkook, J-Hope, and Jimin gear up for their next chapter, here's a look back at five standout tracks that showcase their range, artistry, and connection with fans. Check if your favourite made the list.

general news.headline: Firing at Kapil Sharma's cafe in Canada, Khalistani terrorist claims responsibilityHarjeet Singh Laddi, one of the most-wanted terrorists listed by National Investigation Agency (NIA), has claimed responsibility for the attack on Kapil Sharma's cafe in Canada.

Tennis player Radhika Yadav killed by father over reels, wanted to be influencerA 25-year-old tennis player, Radhika Yadav, was shot dead in her Gurugram home by her father for making reels. She wanted to become a social media influencer.

3rd Test, Day 1 Live: Jadeja penetrates Blockball at Lord'sIndia (IND) vs England (ENG), 3rd Test, Day 1 Live Updates: Ravindra Jadeja dismisses Ollie Pope right in the first ball after Tea. Harry Brook has come to the crease and is giving Joe Root company in the final session of the day.

Sabalenka's semis jinx continues as Anisimova stuns World No.1Wimbledon 2025: World No.1 Aryna Sabalenka crashed out in the semis as Amanda Anisimova of the United States advanced to the semis after beating her 6-4, 4-6, 6-4 on Centre Court.

Bihar voter roll review: Votebandi or necessary? Democratic Newsroom debatesThe top focus of this edition of Democratic Newsroom is the ongoing electoral roll revision exercise in Bihar, initiated by the Election Commission ahead of the state assembly election later this year.

Manipulated Hindus, threat to national security: ED probes UP's Chhangur BabaOfficials said Chhangur Baba amassed assets worth over Rs 100 crore in a few years, allegedly using foreign funding and fraudulent means to promote mass religious conversions, particularly targeting Scheduled Castes and economically weaker sections.

Semi-finals LIVE: USA's Anisimova stuns World No. 1 Sabalenka in semisWimbledon semi-finals Live Updates: Aryna Sabalenka has been shown the door. The World No. 1 has lost the first women's singles semifinal in three sets to 23-year-old Amanda Anisimova. Up next is Iga Swiatek against Belinda Bencic.
'Introducing 'socialist', 'secular' into the Preamble was a deadly sin'Former Delhi High Court judge Justice Shiv Narayan Dhingra (retired) gives his take on the raging debate

The world from Modi's window seat: Tracking PM's flight around the planetThe PM's meetings and events on the ground have been widely covered. But what did his journey look like in the sky? What must Modi have seen from his window?

Top court won't pause Bihar voter roll review, asks poll body to consider AadhaarHearing a clutch of petitions challenging the Election Commission's decision, the Supreme Court said the poll watchdog had a mandate under the Constitution to conduct the exercise.

Moderna Covid vaccine cleared in US for children aged 6 months to 11 yearsModerna's Spikevax was previously available for paediatric populations under emergency use authorisation. Moderna expects to make its updated vaccine available for eligible US population for the 2025-26 respiratory virus season.

Deadlock in BJP? Why 7 key states still await elections for chiefsWhile the quorum for the national president's election is complete, the indecision over chiefs in stronghold states reflects factional tensions and strategic uncertainty

How Karnataka plans to get to the heart of cardiac deaths striking the youngThe state advocates stronger screening and mandatory reporting of sudden heart-attack deaths among individuals aged under 45 to tackle the rising public health concern

Injury scare for Rishabh Pant at Lord's. Can replacement Dhruv Jurel bat if needed?ENG vs IND: India's Rishabh Pant injured his finger while fielding in the third Test at Lord's. Dhruv Jurel substituted him with the gloves in the second session on Day 1.
Watch Space Station with Shux fly over India tonight LIVE hereThe ISS, orbiting at an altitude of about 400 kilometers, will appear as a fast-moving, bright white dot crossing the evening sky.

Wimbledon 2025's best looks came with a side of horological flexWhether it's a vintage Cartier peeking from under a linen cuff or a statement Richard Mille flashing courtside, Wimbledon 2025 is proof that 'timing' is everything, on and off the court.

Can't buy daughter insulin: Debt-ridden businessman shoots himself on Facebook LiveIn the Facebook Live video, the businessman appeared emotional and tearful. He said he was struggling under the burden of crores of rupees in debt and could no longer manage the financial pressure.

Shashi Tharoor as chief minister? MP shares survey naming him top pick in KeralaShashi Tharoor, whose ties with the Congress have been rocky of late, is preferred by 28.3% of respondents as the UDF's chief ministerial candidate, the survey showed.

Chhangur Baba, conversions and caste-based rate listFrom selling gemstones on a bicycle to amassing Rs 106 crore, Chhangur Baba alias Jalaluddin's rise has been swift and secretive. Chhangur Baba has been accused of converting hundreds of women and receiving foreign funds illegally. He reportedly maintained a caste-based rate list for converting women to Islam, offering up to Rs 16 lakh for Brahmins.

Probe confirms no rising trend in sudden cardiac deaths in Karnataka's HassanA Karnataka government-commissioned inquiry into sudden deaths in Hassan district finds no spike in cardiac fatalities. However, the inquiry report suggested that the death of several young adults signalled a need for stronger preventive action.

A young officer, a new father: Story of 2 IAF pilots killed in Rajasthan crashThe pilots, Squadron Leader Lokender Singh Sindhu (31) and Flight Lieutenant Rishi Raj Singh (23), were on a routine training mission when the twin-seater Jaguar crashed in Rajasthan.

Tulsi's return is good news for all. Kyunki saas bhi kabhi viewer thiKyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi, which was the flagship of the K-phenomenon in India, hooked women, saas and bahu alike, for years. Those viewers have been starved of content, with some taking to Pakistani serials, as the OTT-driven entertainment industry moved on to crime and real-life dramas. Tulsi Virani's return is good for viewers, Smriti Irani, who played the protagonist, and the overall content industry.

Government to tighten control of claims portal to check rising hospital bills: ReportIndia is planning to bring its health insurance claims platform under the direct oversight of the finance ministry and insurance regulator, in a bid to rein in rising medical costs and curb overcharging by hospitals, according to a report.

4 Chinese arrested in Greece for clicking photos of Rafale jets, facilitiesA high alert was cautioned after the four individuals of Chinese nationality were found photographing sensitive military installations in the area. As per the sources, their actions were deemed suspicious and raised concerns of espionage, as the images they captured reportedly included Rafale fighter jets.

When Saif Ali Khan told Sharmila Tagore he doesn't want her, recalls Soha Ali KhanActor Soha Ali Khan recently recalled that as a working mother, Sharmila Tagore didn't see Saif Ali Khan for weeks during his childhood. She mentioned how Saif would get upset with mother Sharmila when she came to meet him.

Sunny Deol as Lord Hanuman will have a limited role in the first part with a bigger part in the 2027 sequel, promising a grand spectacle.

The Paradise: Raghav Juyal joins Nani's film, makers share BTS clip on his birthdayOn Raghav Juyal's birthday, the makers of Nani's 'The Paradise' officially welcomed him to the cast with a BTS video. In the clip, director Srikanth Odela teased Juyal's dark and brutal character.

Reacting to the backlash, she said, "It's not that serious," reminding fans not to overthink her food choices.

sports.headline: I want to see Bazball: Mohammed Siraj sledges cautious Joe Root in Lord's TestMohammed Siraj was back to his chirpy best as he sledged Joe Root during Day one of the Lord's Test on Thursday, July 10. Siraj urged Root to play Bazball during a tight spell right after lunch.

Injury scare for Rishabh Pant at Lord's. Can replacement Dhruv Jurel bat if needed?ENG vs IND: India's Rishabh Pant injured his finger while fielding in the third Test at Lord's. Dhruv Jurel substituted him with the gloves in the second session on Day 1.

Watch: India captain Gill speaks Telugu to praise golden arm man Nitish ReddyIndia captain Shubman Gill praised Nitish Kumar Reddy in Telugu after the Indian all-rounder's fantastic spell during the first session of the Lord's Test. Nitish broke the game open for India with two quick wickets.

Shreyanka Patil returns as India A name squads for Australia tourShreyanka Patil has been picked in the T20 squad as India A named their squads for the multi-format tour of Australia. Radha Yadav will lead the visitors with Minnu Mani as her deputy.

Arsenal complete signing of Brentford captain Christian NorgaardArsenal have completed the signing of Brentford captain Christian Norgaard in a bid to shore up their midfield on Thursday, July 10. Norgaard joins Arsenal after spending six seasons at Brentford.

Captain Shubman Gill shines as Nitish Reddy gamble pays off at Lord'sEngland vs India, Lord's Test: Shubman Gill's decision to bring on part-time pacer Nitish Kumar Reddy paid off on Day 1 at Lord's. England lost two wickets in the same over on Thursday.

Semi-finals LIVE: USA's Anisimova stuns World No. 1 Sabalenka in semisWimbledon semi-finals Live Updates: Aryna Sabalenka is currently locking horns with Amanda Anisimova in a quest for a maiden final berth at the All England Club. Later in the day, Iga Świątek will be up against Belinda Bencic.

Shubman Gill's choices as captain have been measured: Sachin TendulkarENG vs IND: Sachin Tendulkar heaped praise on Shubman Gill for scoring runs in heaps and making measured choices as the captain of the Indian Test team.

Just happens with me man: Rishabh Pant reacts to his flying bat anticsRishabh Pant commented on his flying bat antics as the Indian vice-captain lost grip of his willow twice during the Edgbaston Test. Pant has been one of the top scorers in the ongoing series against England.

Who is Laurent Mekies? Red Bull boss who replaces Christian Horner?Red Bull shocked the Formula 1 world on July 9 by sacking Christian Horner. Horner, who was at the position for nearly two decades was replaced by Laurent Mekies.

Captain Shubman Gill shines as Nitish Reddy gamble pays off at Lord'sEngland vs India, Lord's Test: Shubman Gill's decision to bring on part-time pacer Nitish Kumar Reddy paid off on Day 1 at Lord's. England lost two wickets in the same over on Thursday.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
